sentences.english: Thanks for Prohibition and the war against drugs.
sentences.chinese: 感谢禁酒令和与毒品之战。

sentences.english: Here then, is a remedy for intemperance far more effective than all the drug cures that men take.
sentences.chinese: 素食可以禁酒，且比人们所服任何药物都更为有效。

sentences.english: I am practically a teetotaller, but I had at least three.
sentences.chinese: 我基本上是个禁酒主义者，但那次我至少喝了三瓶。

sentences.english: The results from repeal were both immediate and amazing.
sentences.chinese: 撤销禁酒令的结果是最立竿见影和最传奇的。

sentences.english: Crime and corruption sank, with the murder rate falling to its pre-Prohibition level in a manner of a few years.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪与腐败率在几年内就降到了禁酒令实行前的水平。

sentences.english: In reality, most of us wouldn't dream of turning teetotal.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，我们中的大多数人并不想绝对的禁酒。

sentences.english: The temperance [dry; anti-alcohol] movement revived in the city.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市的禁酒运动又活跃起来了。

sentences.english: The temperance league wanted to close all the saloons in town.
sentences.chinese: 禁酒联合会要关闭镇上所有的酒馆。
他们在不断地提出禁酒。

sentences.english: The company bootlegged corn whiskey during Prohibition.
sentences.chinese: 那家公司在禁酒期间偷运玉米威士忌。

sentences.english: After Prohibition, laws made production feasible for only a few huge distilleries.
sentences.chinese: 禁酒令之后，法律只允许一些大酒厂制酒。

sentences.english: I think I am the only teetotaller in the whole Premier League.
sentences.chinese: 我认为我是整个英超唯一一个禁酒的球员。

sentences.english: He died at age 28 after consuming excessive amounts of toxic prohibition-era liquor.
sentences.chinese: 他在28岁那个禁酒时代过渡饮用有毒酒精而猝死。

sentences.english: Tyra, a teetotaler, said food is her only vice.
sentences.chinese: 泰拉是一个禁酒主义者，她说食物是她唯一的软肋。

definition: to ban smoking/to quit smoking/to prohibit cooking/prohibition on opium (esp. in China from 1729)
heavy drinking/to get drunk/to drink to excess
to totally prohibit/to put an end to
to love wine as one's life (idiom); fond of the bottle
